Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice or heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired red and mostly lost); exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (lower part of head, hair, part of wing with added red and shoulder remaining), to right; pendant roundel and dotted square as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93). However, given the thickness of this sherd, it may have belonged to a heavy chalice
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 256, no. 461, pl. 63)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1343) (phase 2)
